query: Computer Science students in USA/Canada for part-time/intern remote work on AI SMS agent project - must be REAL BUILDERS with public GitHub showing shipped software projects

channels.name: GitHub - University AI Agent Projects
channels.description: CS students and recent grads with public AI/LLM agent repositories, often from top universities
channels.searchQuery: university student AI agent projects language:Python

example.name: AdrianIordache
example.description: Ph.D. student in AI at University of Bucharest, proficient in ML/CV/DL. Maintains AI-Masters-Projects repository helping AI students with coursework, assignments, and solutions. Multiple repos on knowledge representation, probabilistic programming, and special topics in AI.

channels.reason: Direct access to students with proven AI project experience, verifiable code quality, active repositories show current engagement. Strong signal of technical ability through public commits and project complexity.

channels.name: LinkedIn - CS Students Seeking AI/ML Internships
channels.description: Computer science students actively seeking internships with AI/ML focus, often with detailed project portfolios
channels.searchQuery: computer science student AI internship seeking

example.name: Soham Patel
example.description: CS student at Rutgers University, proficient in Python/Java/C++/JavaScript. Experience with React, Node.js, Django, Flask, AWS/Azure/GCP. Particular interest in AI/ML/NLP with projects using ChatGPT API, Langchain, TensorFlow, PyTorch. Actively seeking opportunities.

channels.reason: Students explicitly seeking internships are more motivated and responsive. LinkedIn profiles provide verification of education, skills, and project experience. Easy to filter by location (USA/Canada) and graduation timeline.

channels.name: LinkedIn - Stevens Institute CS/AI Students
channels.description: CS students from Stevens Institute of Technology with AI internship experience
channels.searchQuery: Stevens Institute Technology computer science AI

example.name: Victoria Lew
example.description: CS student at Stevens Institute (graduating May 2026), cybersecurity minor. AI Intern & Software QA Engineer Intern at AssetWorks with focus on prompt engineering. Turned ideas into actionable AI solutions with creativity and clear communication. Active in multiple tech student orgs.

channels.reason: Students from tech-focused universities like Stevens show strong CS fundamentals. Existing internship experience proves ability to deliver in professional settings. Active campus involvement suggests good collaboration skills.

channels.name: LinkedIn - Canadian University CS Students
channels.description: Computer science students from Canadian universities actively seeking internships
channels.searchQuery: University Alberta computer science seeking internship

example.name: Andrew Ansah
example.description: CS student at University of Alberta seeking internship, entrepreneurial mindset with passion for solving real-world problems through innovative technology. Built React web app for customized workout plans with exercise selection and tailored workout generation.

channels.reason: Canadian students meet geographic requirement. Entrepreneurial mindset aligns with startup culture. Demonstrated ability to build full-featured web applications independently.

channels.name: Twitter/X - AI Developers Building in Public
channels.description: AI developers and educators sharing daily tips on AI Agents, RAG, and LLMs with large engaged audiences

example.name: @Saboo_Shubham_
example.description: Senior AI PM at Google Cloud, 88.9K followers. Shares daily tips on AI Agents, RAG & LLMs. Created 100+ production-ready AI agent tutorials. Runs 'Awesome LLM Apps' GitHub (60k+ stars). His audience includes many aspiring AI developers and students.

channels.reason: Large engaged audience of AI learners and builders. While Shubham himself isn't a student, his follower base and engagement represents a concentration of aspiring AI developers. Can reach students through replies and engagement on his educational content.

channels.name: GitHub - 2026 AI/ML College Jobs Repository Contributors
channels.description: Students contributing to and following internship tracking repositories, demonstrating active job search

example.name: speedyapply/2026-AI-College-Jobs
example.description: Community-maintained repository tracking AI/ML internships and new grad positions, updated daily. Contributors and watchers are actively seeking 2026 opportunities. Repository has significant engagement from CS students specifically interested in AI/ML roles.

channels.reason: Self-selecting audience of students specifically seeking AI/ML internships. Can engage through GitHub issues, discussions, or by following stargazers/watchers. Students are already familiar with Git/GitHub, meeting technical baseline.

channels.name: Buildspace Demo Day Showcases
channels.description: Students who completed buildspace's 6-week program and showcased AI projects at demo day
channels.searchQuery: buildspace s4 demo day AI projects

example.name: Michael Vandi (LangDrive)
example.description: Built LangDrive (AI library for training 100+ open-source LLMs via API) during MS in Software Engineering at Carnegie Mellon. Now founder of Addy AI. Example of buildspace-style builder who ships functional AI products. Demonstrates the caliber of builders in buildspace community.

channels.reason: Buildspace attracts serious builders who complete 6-week intensive programs (only 10% finish). 1000+ projects showcased at S4 demo day. Strong 'build in public' culture aligns with project needs. Students have proven ability to ship.

github.approach: Search for university AI/agent projects, filter by recent activity, examine commit history and README quality
github.contact_method: Open issues on their repos asking if interested in part-time work, or direct email if available in profile

linkedin.approach: Search for CS students by university + 'seeking internship' + AI/ML keywords, filter by graduation year 2025-2027
linkedin.contact_method: Direct LinkedIn message or InMail highlighting project details and technical challenges
qualification_signals: Technical skills list matches tech stack

twitter.approach: Follow and engage with AI educators' content, reach audience through thoughtful replies about the project
twitter.contact_method: Reply to relevant tweets with project details, or DM engaged followers who show interest
qualification_signals: GitHub links in bio or tweets

buildspace.approach: Review demo day projects for AI-related work, reach out to builders who shipped functional products
buildspace.contact_method: LinkedIn or Twitter DM to demo day participants with relevant projects
qualification_signals: Active on social media sharing progress

notes: All examples verified through web search with real URLs
Focus on students graduating 2025-2027 for best availability
GitHub and LinkedIn provide strongest verification of skills
Community platforms (buildspace) provide cultural fit signals
Prioritize students already seeking opportunities for higher response rates
